location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Map of Damara and Great Namaqua Land and the Adjacent Countries to and beyond Lake Ngami as explored and surveyed by Messrs Galton & Andersson'

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:421 x 512 mm; on sheet 451 x 548 mmFoliation:The map has been foliated in the top right hand corner with a pencil number enclosed in a circle.

mods.abstract: Imprint:London, Published by Hurst and Blackett. Drawn by E Ravenstein; Engraved on stone by Schenck and McFarlane Lithographers, Edinburgh.Distinctive Features:Relief shown by hachures.Below title the note 'The coast from 20Â° South lat, to Walfisch Bay is from the survey of Capt. William Messum. The rest of the coast has been corrected from the observation of that navigator'.Shows the routes of the expeditions: Messrs Galton and Andersson in 1851 by pecked line and Mr Andersson in 1853 by black line.Includes an inset: 'Sketch Map of South Africa to show the progress of discovery' which shows routes of various expeditions between 1812 and 1854.
